"Yes..." Zed looked down at the small vial that stood on a pedestal before him. Decked out in his white shockblade robes, he had secretly snuck into Ionia and with the help of some of Karma's unguarded notes, had located a vial of very rare and mysterious poison. When he was a young child he remember his master speaking of such a potion, of it's powers and dangers. After some research with the dark sovereign Syndra, Zed had come to conclude the "poison" was actually a brew made by the elders of Ionia to give anyone immense power.

Specifically it was a size potion. The user of it would grow to titanic heights, towering over buildings and human beings. It was the perfect revenge on Ionia and all those who had wronged him in his past. Unfortunately the liquid was in a heavily secluded cave deep within the Ionian monastery. Zed had dressed in white to avoid detection but it still had been a difficult journey, having been nearly spotted by both Irelia and a visiting Xin Zhao.

But now, it was his. The power, the immense power that came with being a giant, all within his grasp. Too long had he been looked down upon, shunned by his home by his choices in the dark arts. But now they would pay, with fear and with blood.

The ninja slowly removed the vial and looked at the dark red liquid. Without a second thought he pulled down his mask, uncorked the potion and poured it down his throat. Quickly afterwards he bounded out of the cave, shifting left and right with his shadows. If he was going to grow into a giant, he wanted all of Ionia to see.
153.title: Revenge Is The Sweetest

1531.content:
It really was going to happen. Zed made his way out of the cave, the sun shining brightly on his white shockblade armor.From his position he could see all of Ionia, the peaceful traditional town not too far off in the distance. Perfect.

As the afternoon sun rose high into the sky the ninja soon noticed a warm feeling in his stomach. It was like a bubbling fire, something inside him waiting to burst out. He could feel warmth spreading through his veins, as if mixing itself with his body, transforming it for the better.

The first thing he noticed was his feet. Looking down Zed silently watched himself, his feet, including the ninja tabi on them were growing larger, expanding in volume at a sturdy pace. His hands too, were growing. Zed closed his eyes and waited.

Suddenly, the warmth turned into a sharp pain and it shot throughout him.Zed grunted slightly but maintained his composure. He wanted to appear like a god as he grew until he was literally a titan to the people of Ionia. He wanted them to see his transformation.

Within moments, Zed was was standing at ten feet tall. His feet now on either end of the small narrow path that lead into the cave. Preparing himself he held a pose, his arms flexed at his sides, his face upwards at the sky.

In Ionia people had begun to notice him. The first was a little boy, who pulled eagerly at his mother's sleeve, pointing at the white figure in front of the cave high above the city. Soon many more had noticed as well and had stopped to stare. None could make out what exactly the white was but curiosity got the better of them and most stood still to watch as the figure in the distance slowly seemingly expanded in size.

Meanwhile Zed's growth was becoming more and more rapid. He could feel his body getting massive but refused to move, even when the ground underneath him began to creak and crack. No matter. He wanted everyone to see. He wanted them to know what was about to happen.

By this point the people of Ionia had come to realize something was wrong. Many began to panic and scream as people recognized the exiled ninja as he grew bigger and bigger. Some could only watch in horror as Zed's massive shape filled up, looking bigger and bigger. The village elders had gathered in a circle in the courtyard. Nobody was sure exactly what to do.

After a while Zed felt his transformation stop. Opening his eyes he found himself looking at a completely different world. He could see miles ahead of him. Looking down he was pleased and overjoyed to see a small, miniature play city not too far off, - what he assumed must have been Ionia. The village was small by his comparison. Probably one of his footsteps covered entire houses. Looking around him he found the forest that once surrounded the region only went up to his knees. Zed guessed he was 50, maybe sixty feet tall.

There was no point in waiting. Creating small earthquakes as he went, Zed headed for the city. He was going to have some fun.

The crimson liquid spat and crackled inside of him. All of a sudden Zed collapsed to his knees in agony, white clothes colliding with the wet ground and being stained. Groaning, the Shadow Master had no idea how much time had passed as he woke up with a throbbing headache. He tried to figure out where exactly he had ended up as he looked around. Giant green towers were all around him like a thick forest - Ionia was full of strange and magical scenery but Zed had never seen anything like this before! Zed pressed against one of the green spikes and sniffed his gloved hand - it was an earthy smell. Undoubtedly the smell of grass - but grass could never grow this tall...

That was when a horrible idea struck Zed and the ninja rushed forward, slipping in between the earthy spires as he looked for a sign of what might have happened. Zed once again felt that horrible feeling as the engorged insect confirmed his horrible belief - that red vial that was supposed to grow him to a giant size to destroy Ionia had instead reduced him to a pitiful speck size!

"No, I do not want any of your biscuits Morgana." The unamused ninja rubbed his head.

"Well it's your loss." An angry glare from the Fallen Angel sent Shen scurrying away at record pace. Talk about light failing to catch a ninja.

It had been a tiring day on the fields of justice. Twice Shen had to sacrifice himself to save that blond explorer Ezreal, who always seemed to be getting into trouble.Brushing some dust and debris off his ninja garm Shen quietly made his way into the room the institute had provided for the champions to stay in if they wanted. He knew Akali and Kennen had both headed back to Ionia for training, but at the moment he was far too exhausted to join them.

As the ninja collapsed into bed, he was interrupted by a knock on the door. Finding strength in himself he managed to mutter out a few words. "Come on."

The door opened and a cheery Lulu bounced in, a cupcake in her hand. "Hiya Shen! Thank you sooo much for saving Ezreal today!" The purple yordle giggled and held placed the cupcake on a desk beside the bed. "Well toodles. Enjoy your sugary treat!"

Shen wanted the girl come and go. How strange. Oh well, he supposed it would be rude to let the cupcake go to waste. Effortlessly he grabbed it and popped it into his mouth, finding the dessert chewy and sweet.

Feeling the wave of exhaustion run over him again, Shen fell back against the bed. His room was dark and empty with simple furniture for a simple man like himself. Within moments the ninja was fast asleep.

He was awoken by the sound of noisy chattering outside. Groggily Shen opened one eye, his vision still blurry from the rest he just took. It was hard to tell where the noise was coming from or what was being said but he thought he heard Zed and someone arguing against him. Maybe he was dreaming. Either way, Shen wanted back in his slumber.

Wait. No, something was wrong. As his vision became more focused the Eye of Twilight immediately noticed some strange differences. The cot he was resting on, had it always been this wide? From where he was the edge looked...several meters away. That couldn't be right. Reaching up he rubbed his eyes. No...wait. Yes! Something was wrong, definitely wrong.

With a jolt the ninja sat up in bed, except, it looked more like a white field to him. What was going on? His bed was gigantic! No wait...

Years of training his senses allowed Shen to adapt quickly. No, his bed wasn't gigantic. He was tiny. And sitting there in the middle of his bed made it seem like he was out in an open field. Judging by that Shen estimated he was no more than a few inches tall.

It had to be Morgana. Those sweets she gave him. They must have been cursed. He should have known better than to trust a fallen angel. It didn't surprise him one bit that this happened. He had a misjudgment, he wasn't focused and when he let his guard down, things didn't go his way.

The question was, what now?

The visitor was a surprise though. Zed walked in, wearing his hood and mask from his SK1 costume. Strange. What was Zed doing here? "I'm going to make this simple." Zed stood firmly behind the bed, his gaze alone locking Shen into place. "Think of this as revenge for all that's happened before. And don't try to run, or else you'll be seeing the underside of my foot."

Blinking quickly to the exit, Zed shut the door firmly, encasing the room in an eerie darkness with only slivers of moonlight shining through the window. Calmly the giant stood still and spoke. "So...you want to run. Then let us play a game. See if you can avoid me!"

Yasuo usually didn't like attending these frivolous ceremonies, but it was probably inconsiderate to reject such an invitation. Not to mention everyone else in Ionia was going. Today, like most days he had snuck out to hide in one of the guest rooms, tempering his flute and occasionally lying on the bed. He was clean today since Varus had forced him in a bathtub earlier so nobody would even notice.

He had been facing away from the door when Jayce burst in, checking a photograph on the nightstand. Before he could react however, Yasuo was blinded by the light that seemingly appeared out of nowhere. He thought he heard Jayce say something but couldn't see clearly.

The next thing he knew, he was standing on the floor, the world around him dark and unrecognizable. Looking to his left he saw that would have been the leg stand of the wooden nightstand, except his head barely went up more than a few inches from the floor. It didn't take the wanderer long to figure out what had happened. Jayce had shrunk him. Or, whatever had happened in that light show did. He was surprised how fast he came to the conclusion. Probably had something to do with him seeing it all on the fields.

As quickly as that realization came, another did as well. Moments before Jayce had burst into the room. Yasuo blinked and slowly turned away from the nightstand to face the giant intruder. What he saw made him go speechless.

There standing at the door was the titantic figure of the Piltovian defender, decked out in his usual debonair uniform. The sight was startling and horrifying.

As he looked onward, Jayce began moving and Yasuo quickly fell backwards. He watched as Jayce lifted his feet and walked forward a single step before two giant black and white dress shoes landed with a thud on either side of him. Yasuo couldn't take his eyes off of the giant, even now as he was "trapped" between Jayce's mammoth shoes. Looking to one side he could see his own reflection in the shiny black leather. Looking up, Yasuo was faced with two towering legs, black pants that went upwards until he could see the outline of Jayce's white coat. The other man apparently hadn't noticed him and Yasuo saw his eyes went forwards to something behind him. Turning around he saw what looked like, at his size, a broken UFO in pieces.

"There's got to be something..." Yasuo turned back at Jayce who was muttering to himself, the defender's toned body like a mountain in front of him. He had to get the giant's attention, fast.

He felt movement along his tongue and knew how crazy it was in there but one by one, the humans fell into his stomach. As he had promised, the lone survivor was pulled out and Rakan addressed him directly. Looking closer at the individual he noticed it wasn’t actually a regular human but instead it was a tiny Zed.
